Question:
あの後のスーパーでも同じやり取り。
気まずくてしばらくあの商店街に行けないぞ。
……まぁネコの可愛いところと言われればそうなんだけども。
[バニラ]: 「ん？　くんくん、くんくん……」
[バニラ]: 「あっちからすごくいい匂いがする」
[ショコラ]: 「ほんとだ、すごく香ばしくていい匂いがしますご主人さま！」
[嘉祥]: 「確かに。この匂いは……」
匂いのする方角へと顔を向ける。
[屋台のネコ]: 「いらっしゃいませー！」
[屋台のネコ]: 「おいしいできたてのたこやき、いかがですかー！」
[屋台のネコ]: 「あっつあつで、かつおぶしたっぷりのたこやき、いかがですかー！」
[ショコラ]: 「わぁ、ネコのたこ焼き屋さんだ！　珍しいですね、ご主人さま！」
reference_answer:
After that, it was the same sort of exchange at the supermarket.
The whole thing was so awkward that I don't think I can visit that shopping district for a while.
... Well, I guess you could say that was the cute side of catgirls.
[Vanilla]: 「Hmm? Sniff sniff, sniff sniff...」
[Vanilla]: 「Something smells really nice over there.」
[Chocola]: 「You're right! Something smells really good, Master!」
[Kashou]: 「It definitely does. What is this smell...」
I turned towards the source of it.
[Food Stand Cat]: 「Welcome~!」
[Food Stand Cat]: 「Would you like to try some delicious, fresh takoyaki~?」
[Food Stand Cat]: 「Would you like to try some piping hot takoyaki with lots of bonito flakes on top~?」
[Chocola]: 「Wah, it's a takoyaki shop run by a catgirl! That's pretty rare, huh, Master?!」
ModelAnswer:
That same exchange happened at the supermarket after that. I won't be able to go back to that shopping street for a while, it's so awkward... Well, if you're talking about cute cat things, then yeah, I guess.

[VANILLA]: "Hmm? Sniff sniff..."
[VANILLA]: "There's a really good smell coming from over there."
[CHOCOLA]: "Really! It smells so fragrant and delicious, Master!"

He turns his face towards the source of the smell.

[CART CAT]: "Welcome!"

Question:
[ショコラ]: 「いい子になれるようにって！」
[バニラ]: 「時雨、厳しい。でもお陰様で色々と覚えた」
[店主]: 「そうなんだ？　良いご主人様なのね」
[ショコラ]: 「あ、でもご主人さまはご主人さまなんです！」
[ショコラ]: 「時雨ちゃんは時雨ちゃんですから！　ね、ご主人さま？」
[バニラ]: 「通訳すると、時雨は大事な友達」
[バニラ]: 「ご主人って呼ぶのはこっちのご主人だけってことで」
[店主]: 「あはは。愛されてるんだね、ご主人さまは？」
[嘉祥]: 「まぁ、ありがたいことに」
肘で軽く小突かれる。
照れくさいような苦笑いで返事を返す。
……外だと流石にちょっと照れくさい。
reference_answer:
[Chocola]: 「She said we'd grow up to be good catgirls if we listened to her!」
[Vanilla]: 「Shigure was tough on us. But thanks to her, we learned a lot.」
[Food Stand Owner]: 「Really? What a wonderful owner you have.」
[Chocola]: 「Ah, but Master is Master!」
[Chocola]: 「And Shigure-chan is Shigure-chan! Right, Master?」
[Vanilla]: 「In other words, Shigure is an important friend.」
[Vanilla]: 「And when we say 'Master,' we are referring to Master over here.」
[Food Stand Owner]: 「Ahaha! You're a very well-loved "master," aren't you?」
[Kashou]: 「Well, I am grateful.」
She lightly nudged me with her elbow.
I responded with an embarrassed, forced smile.
... Hearing this kind of stuff in public sure was embarrassing.
ModelAnswer:
[Chocola]: "So I can be a good girl!"
[Vanilla]: "Shigure, you're strict. But thanks to that, I've learned so much."
[Master]: "Is that so? You must have a wonderful Master then."
[Chocola]: "Ah, but the Master is still the Master!"
[Chocola]: "And Shigure-chan is Shigure-chan! Right, Master?"
[Vanilla]: "In translation, Shigure is an important friend."
[Vanilla]: "It's just that we only call you 'Master' here."
[Master]: "Ahaha. You're loved, huh, Master?"
[Kashou]: "Well, I'm grateful for it."

He gets lightly nudged with her elbow.
He replies with a slightly embarrassed smile.
...Out in public, it would be a bit embarrassing.

As the ruthless electronic buzz of the dropped call echoed, I stared at my cell phone.

metadata: [character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
Question:
ハキハキとした笑顔で伝票とペンを差し出される。
[嘉祥]: 「そうですね、えっと……」
受け取った伝票を改めて確認する。
[嘉祥]: 「……どうも、自分が頼んだものと違うみたいなんですけども」
[食器業者]: 「……え、本当ですか？」
[食器業者]: 「それは、品物が違う……ということでしょうか？」
[嘉祥]: 「いえ、頼んだものも確かに入ってるみたいなのですが……」
店内に積まれたダンボールへと視線を向ける。
小さな店内に積まれたダンボールの山、山、山。
むしろ店内がほぼダンボールになっていた。
[嘉祥]: 「見ての通り、ウチではこんなにたくさんの食器は必要ないので……」
[食器業者]: 「す、すみません！　すぐに本社に確認しますので！」
[食器業者]: 「少々お待ち頂いてもよろしいでしょうか！？」
reference_answer:
She smiled brightly and brought out the invoice along with a pen.
[Kashou]: 「Okay, let's see...」
I looked over the sales invoice I received once more.
[Kashou]: 「... Somehow, this doesn't look like what I ordered.」
[Tableware Seller]: 「... Huh, is that so?」
[Tableware Seller]: 「Are you saying that these... aren't the correct items?」
[Kashou]: 「No, the stuff I ordered is in here too, but...」
I looked over at the pile of boxes inside the bakery.
Inside of my tiny bakery was a mountain of boxes. A MOUNTAIN.
It was as if the inside of the bakery had become completely made of boxes.
[Kashou]: 「As you can see, we don't need this much tableware inside the bakery...」
[Tableware Seller]: 「I-I'm sorry! I'll check with the main office right away!」
[Tableware Seller]: 「Could you give me a few moments?」
ModelAnswer:
A clear, smiling face hands over the receipt and pen.  
[Kashou]: "Ah, yes... let's see..."  
He takes the receipt and checks it again.  
[Kashou]: "...I'm afraid what I received doesn't quite match what I ordered."  
[Dinnerware Vendor]: "Eh? Really?"  
[Dinnerware Vendor]: "So, you're saying the items are different...?"  
[Kashou]: "No, everything I ordered seems to be here..."  
His gaze shifts to the stacks of cardboard boxes piled inside.  
Stacks upon stacks of cardboard boxes in the small shop.  
Almost the entire store was filled with them.  
[Kashou]: "As you can see, we don't need this many dishes at our place..."  
[Dinnerware Vendor]: "S-sorry! I'll check with headquarters right away!"  
[Dinnerware Vendor]: "Would it be alright if you waited a moment?!"

metadata: [character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
Question:
[食器業者]: 「こちらのミスで、別の注文書と混じってしまっていたようでして……」
[食器業者]: 「水無月様の方もすぐにご入用と思いますので……」
[食器業者]: 「もしよろしければ、ご注文分の食器を受け取って頂ければと思うのですが……」
[嘉祥]: 「注文分を受け取れって……」
[嘉祥]: 「……え？　この中からですか？」
そびえ立つダンボールの山。
思わず言葉に詰まる。
どれも一様に同じ箱なわけで。
中身を開けてみるまで何が入っているのか分からない。
しかも伝票を見ればどれも最高級のティーセットや食器。
なので、扱いにも細心の注意を払わないととんでもないことになる。
[嘉祥]: 「あの、確かに開店準備もあるので今日もらえたら嬉しいですけども……」
[嘉祥]: 「……今からこれを全部って、相当時間かかりますよね？」
reference_answer:
[Tableware Seller]: 「Because of an error on our part, it appears that another order got mixed in with yours...」
[Tableware Seller]: 「I imagine that you may be in need of these items right away, Mr. Minaduki...」
[Tableware Seller]: 「So if at all possible, if you would be able to accept this order...」
[Kashou]: 「Accept this order...」
[Kashou]: 「... Huh? From all this?」
The mountain of cardboard boxes towered over everything.
I was at a loss for words.
Every box was of equal size.
I wouldn't know what was inside each of them without opening them up.
On top of that, looking at the sales invoice, I could see that they all contained expensive tea sets and tableware.
And if I accepted it all, it would be a lot of work to deal with all the new items.
[Kashou]: 「Uhm, there's still things that need doing in advance of my bakery's opening, so I don't mind accepting these...」
[Kashou]: 「... but it's going to take a while to deal with all of this.」
ModelAnswer:
[Dinnerware Supplier]: "It seems there was a mix-up on our end, and your order got mixed with another one..."
[Dinnerware Supplier]: "Since you'll need these items from the Minaduki household urgently as well..."
[Dinnerware Supplier]: "...if it's alright with you, we'd like to have you take delivery of the ordered dinnerware."
[嘉祥]: "Take delivery of the order...?"
[嘉祥]: "...Huh? From this pile?"
A towering mountain of cardboard boxes.
He was momentarily speechless.
They all looked exactly the same.
Until he opened them, he wouldn't know what was inside.
And looking at the invoices, they were all top-of-the-line tea sets and dinnerware.
So, if he wasn't careful, something terrible could happen.
[嘉祥]: "Well, I'd be happy to get it today since we're preparing for opening..."
[嘉祥]: "...but going through all of this now is going to take a considerable amount of time, isn't it?"

でも今日は屋台は見当たらない。
ネコたちを実家に送ろうにも今日に限って誰もおらず。
俺も実家の鍵は置いて来てしまっていた。

reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「... It must be pretty nice to live the simple life of a catgirl, huh?」
I pondered as I looked at the name of the bakery affixed to the window.
With a bitter smile, I began to clean up the tea sets that had arrived earlier.
[Vanilla]: 「Huh, that takoyaki seller isn't here today.」
Just like yesterday, we took a walk through the park in the evening.
However, that food stand was nowhere to be found.
It just so happened that no one was home on the day I decided to take the two catgirls home.
I had also happened to leave the house key behind.
So to make good use of time, I went to do some shopping before Shigure got home.
[Chocola]: 「... Eh? Ah, s-sorry, Vanilla!」
[Chocola]: 「What was it called... catnip?」
[Vanilla]: 「That sounds about right.」
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: "...If only I could live as simply as a cat, things would be easier."
He glanced at the shop name plastered on the window.
Shaking off his wry smile, he began to put away the newly arrived tea set.

[Vanilla]: "Hey, that takoyaki stand isn't here today."
The same park street in the evening as yesterday.
But there's no sign of the stall today.
I wanted to send the cats back home, but for some reason, nobody was around just today.
And I'd even forgotten my house keys.
So I'm doing some shopping while waiting for Shigure to get home.

[Chocola]: "...Eh? Ah, s-sorry Vanilla!"
[Chocola]: "What was it again... matatabi?"
[Vanilla]: "Something like that."

... It seemed that selling out and closing early on opening day actually got us noticed.

Her smile stabbed at my heart.
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: "Thanks to Shigure, we've had more customers than expected."

[Shigure]: "Oh? What are you talking about?"

I decided not to press the matter further.

Shigure chuckled softly and tilted her head in response. If she were going to answer honestly, she would have said it directly.

That's just like Shigure, always been that way.

[Shigure]: "I understand what you're saying, Brother."

[Shigure]: "But cats are clever creatures. They can become family members or partners for humans."

[Shigure]: "...Which is precisely why..."

She paused for a breath.

Then she looked at me with an apologetic smile.

[Shigure]: "...It must be lonely not to have someone rely on you, don't you think?"

Her smile made my chest ache.

metadata:
[character] Name: Minaduki Shigure (水無月 時雨) | Gender: Female
[character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
Question:
携帯の画面を見て眉根を寄せる。
そのまま動かない時雨を見て着信元を察する。
[嘉祥]: 「実家からだろ？　早く出ないと」
[時雨]: 「……用件など出ずとも分かります。行き先を告げずに出て来たので」
時雨の手の中の携帯が鳴り止む。
同じように時雨も黙ったまま、
携帯をぎゅっと握り締める。
[時雨]: 「……私がまだ年端もいかぬ女だからですか？」
[時雨]: 「それとも、世間知らずの子どもだからですか？」
[時雨]: 「……だから、私はお父さまとお母さまの言うことに従わねばならないのでしょうか」
[時雨]: 「……私は、ここにいたいのです」
[時雨]: 「兄さまが苦しまれてる時くらい……せめて、お傍にいるだけでも……」
reference_answer:
She looked at her phone and furrowed her brows.
When Shigure just sat there motionlessly, I could pretty much figure out who it was.
[Kashou]: 「It's from home, right? You should answer.」
[Shigure]: 「... I don't need to answer to know what they want. I left without saying where I was going.」
The cell phone in Shigure's hand stopped ringing.
Shigure fell silent...
... and gripped the cell phone tightly.
[Shigure]: 「... Is it because I'm still a young girl?」
[Shigure]: 「... Or is it because I'm naïve to the world?」
[Shigure]: 「... Is that why I must do what mother and father ask of me?」
[Shigure]: 「... I want to be here.」
[Shigure]: 「When Nii-sama is suffering... at the very least, let me be by his side...」
ModelAnswer:
Minaduki Shigure frowned, looking at her phone screen.  
Seeing that Shigure wasn't moving, Kashou guessed the caller.  
[Kashou]: "It's from your parents' house, isn't it? You should answer quickly."  
[Shigure]: "...I know what they want even before I pick up. Because I left without telling them where I was going."  
The phone in Shigure's hand stopped ringing.  
Just like Kashou, Shigure remained silent,  
gripping her phone tightly.  
[Shigure]: "...Is it because I'm still just a girl who hasn't grown up yet?"  
[Shigure]: "Or is it because I'm an innocent child who knows nothing of the world?"  
[Shigure]: "...So that's why I have to obey Father and Mother, is it?"  
[Shigure]: "...I want to stay here."  
[Shigure]: "Even if just for when my brother is suffering... at least, to be by his side..."

Question:

不安でぎゅっと手を握り合う。
冷たいシャッターを見上げて下唇をきゅっと噛む。
[警察]: 「キミたち、何してるの？」
[ショコラ]: 「あ……警察さん！」
[ショコラ]: 「開いてる病院教えてもらえませんか！？」
[ショコラ]: 「ご主人さまが大変で！　それで、お医者さん呼ぼうと思って！」
[バニラ]: 「病院が休みで、どうすればいいか分からなくて……」
[警察]: 「飼い主さんが？　それは大変だけど……」
[警察]: 「キミたち鈴は？　持ってないの？」
[ショコラ＆バニラ]: 「あっ……！」
指摘されて首元に手を当てる。
reference_answer:
[Vanilla]: 「We don't know any other clinics... and there aren't any people on the street to ask.」
[Vanilla]: 「We can't just go back like this... What should we...」
We gripped each other's hands tightly in worry.
Looking up at the cold shutters, we chewed our lips in concern.
[Police Officer]: 「What are you two doing there?」
[Chocola]: 「Ah... Ms. Policewoman!」
[Chocola]: 「Where's the closest open clinic?!」
[Chocola]: 「Master is in trouble, so we wanted to get a doctor!」
[Vanilla]: 「The clinic is closed and we don't know what to do...」
[Police Officer]: 「Your Master is? That's a quite a problem, but...」
[Police Officer]: 「Where are your Bells? Don't you have them?」
[Chocola&Vanilla]: 「Ah...!」
We touched our necks where she pointed.
ModelAnswer:
[VANILLA]: "I don't know where any other hospitals are... and there's no one around to ask for directions..."
[VANILLA]: "But I can't just go home like this... what should we do..."
Anxious, she grips her hands together tightly.
She looks up at the cold shutter and bites her lower lip.
[OFFICER]: "What are you two doing?"
[CHOCOLA]: "Ah... Officer!"
[CHOCOLA]: "Can you tell us where an open hospital is!?"
[CHOCOLA]: "My master's in trouble! That's why we're trying to get a doctor!"
[VANILLA]: "The hospitals are closed, and we don't know what to do..."
[OFFICER]: "Your owner? That's terrible... but..."
[OFFICER]: "You two don't have your bells?"
[CHOCOLA & VANILLA]: "Ah...!"
Pointed out, they touch their necks.

[character] Name: Minaduki Shigure (水無月 時雨) | Gender: Female
[character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
Question:
朝イチから予想外の光景に頭がついて来てくれない。
[時雨]: 「おはようございます、兄さま」
[時雨]: 「私は今回の一件で色々と考えたのです」
晴れ晴れとした曇りの無い笑顔。
他のネコたちも同じように笑顔を俺に向けている。
つう、と冷たい汗が伝うのを感じながら、
[嘉祥]: 「はぁ……考えたって、何を……？」
何とかそれだけを口にする。
[時雨]: 「今回の一件で、兄さまに無理をするなというのが無理なことがよく分かりました」
[時雨]: 「ですが、私も妹として夜も眠れぬほど心配をさせられたのもまた事実……」
[時雨]: 「ならば人員を増やして、兄さまの負担を減らすのが一番の得策と、時雨は考えたのです」
[嘉祥]: 「…………はぁ」
reference_answer:
The first thing I saw this morning was so unexpected, my brain couldn't process it all.
[Shigure]: 「Good morning, Nii-sama.」
[Shigure]: 「This recent incident has gotten me thinking...」
She wore a sunny smile that no cloud could cover up.
The catgirls looked at me with similar smiles.
I felt myself break out in a cold sweat...
[Kashou]: 「Haah... thinking... about what...?」
I only managed to get out that much.
[Shigure]: 「After that incident, I learned that there's no way to keep Nii-sama from attempting to achieve the impossible.」
[Shigure]: 「However, it's also a fact that his dear little sister -- namely me -- is losing sleep from worrying about him so much.」
[Shigure]: 「Then, I thought that maybe having more workers would lessen Nii-sama's burden. That was the best plan.」
[Kashou]: 「...... Huh.」
ModelAnswer:
I can't wrap my head around this unexpected scene first thing in the morning.
[Shigure]: "Good morning, Master."
[Shigure]: "I've been thinking a lot about what happened recently."
A bright, unclouded smile.
The other cats are smiling at me too.
I feel a cold sweat trickle down my back as I manage to say,
[Kashou]: "Haa... What did you think about...?"
[Shigure]: "From this incident, I realized that telling Master not to overwork himself is impossible."
[Shigure]: "But it's also true that I was so worried as a sister that I couldn't sleep at night..."
[Shigure]: "Therefore, the best solution would be to increase personnel and reduce Master's workload, Shigure thinks."
[Kashou]: "...Haa."

reference_answer:
That's all I say before leaving the Minaduki house. Almost as if I'm running away.
I have so many things running through my mind that my thoughts are a jumbled mess.
Before I realize it, I'm standing in the park in the middle of the night.
[Kashou]: 「Aah...」

Vanilla is holding my bag.

[Kashou]: 「Good point.」
Without the key to the house, not only would I be locked out, but so would these two.

Before I knew it, I was in a park at night.
Kashou: "Ah..."
I'd forgotten to take my house key and wallet; everything was still in my bag.
Kashou: "...What am I doing?"
Chocola: "...Master."

In Vanilla's hand was my bag.

Without the key, I wouldn't just be locked out; the two of them would be too.

Question:

大袈裟な――と思ったが、俺は時雨の応援に甘えることにした。
チェックインを済ませ、部屋へ。

reference_answer:

[Kashou]: 「I do appreciate you saying that, but still...」
[Shigure]: 「In fact, it is my purpose in life. My nourishment, my essential nutrients, my water, air, and sunlight.」
While I think she's exaggerating like crazy, I decide to take Shigure up on her support.
We finish checking in and head to our rooms.

Exaggerated, I thought, but I decided to indulge Shigure's support.

metadata: [character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
Question:
仕入れ先に頼みたいことがあった。急ぎではないが、早いうちに電話しておいたほうがいい。
個人経営のパティスリーなら普通のことだと思うが、俺は仕入れ先の一つ一つと自分で交渉をしている。
一般流通されていないような食材も、まとまった量を仕入れるなら、売ってくれる農家もある。
味の探究は、食材を探す旅でもあった。
皆が観光で盛り上がっているときに、仕事の話をするのも野暮なので、俺は私用があると言って、部屋を離れる。
念のために旅館からも出て、静かな場所で話すことにした。
電話をかける。
[嘉祥]: 「Bonjour, c'est Kashou Minaduki de La Soleil Japon. Est-ce que je pourrais parler à M. James Carter?」
[嘉祥]: 「ふぅ……」
国外からの注文ということで先方に驚かれたが、どうにか発送してくれそうだ。
俺は旅館の中へと戻る。
reference_answer:
There's something I wanna request from a supplier. It's no rush, but it's a good idea to give him a phone call as soon as possible.
I think it's pretty common for an independently-owned patisserie, but I negotiate with every single supplier on my own.
Even for ingredients not in circulation for the general public, if I need to replenish my supply of them in bulk, there are farmers who will buy it for me.
Researching flavors is also a journey to search for ingredients.
Since it'd be uncouth of me to talk about work when everyone is excited about sightseeing, I tell them that I have personal business to take care of and leave the room.
Just to be sure, I leave the inn and decide to talk someplace quieter.
I make my phone call.
[Kashou]: 「Bonjour, c'est Kashou Minaduki de La Soleil Japon. Est-ce que je pourrais parler à M. James Carter?」
[Kashou]: 「Phew...」
I was met with surprise from the other person on the line since it was an order from overseas, but it seems they'll be putting in my order.
I return to the inn.
ModelAnswer:
I had something I wanted to request from my supplier. It wasn't urgent, but it would be best to call them soon.

It's probably normal for a small pastry shop, but I personally negotiate with each of my suppliers.

Even farmers who don't sell their produce through general distribution might sell in bulk if the quantity is right.

The pursuit of flavor was also a journey to find ingredients.

Since everyone else was excited about sightseeing, it wouldn't be appropriate to talk business. So, I said I had personal matters and left the room.

Just in case, I went outside the inn to have a quiet conversation.

I made the call.

KASHOU: "Bonjour, this is Kashou Minaduki from La Soleil Japon. May I speak with Mr. James Carter?"

KASHOU: "Phew..."

They were surprised by an order from overseas, but they seemed willing to ship it somehow.

I returned to the inn.

[Maple]: 「I admit that I was surprised at how capable you were, but you should still be a far cry from my skills.」
[Vanilla]: 「...Oh, Cinnamon is calling us.」
[Maple]: 「Huh?」
And the moment that Maple's eyes go astray—
[Vanilla]: 「Wide open!」
With a loud 'tic' of the ball being ricocheted across the table, Vanilla serves an ace over Maple.
[Vanilla]: 「Victory.」
ModelAnswer:
[Maple]: "Well, I'm not exactly avoiding you on purpose, am I?"
[Vanilla]: "I should probably play with you sometimes."
[Maple]: "That's something the senior member of this group would say!"
[Vanilla]: "Hehe... I haven't even started using my full strength yet."
[Maple]: "No way!? No, that can't be..."
[Maple]: "I was surprised to see Vanilla is surprisingly skilled, but I should still be faster than you."
[Vanilla]: "...Ah, Cinnamon's calling me."
[Maple]: "Huh?"
The moment Maple averted her gaze—
[Vanilla]: "Opening!"
*Kachin!* The ball bounced off with a sharp sound as Vanilla's service ace landed.
[Vanilla]: "Victory."

metadata:
[character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
[character] Name: Minaduki Shigure (水無月 時雨) | Gender: Female
Question:
[嘉祥]: 「どれ、１つ食べてみるか」
屋台で温泉まんじゅうを１つ買った。
できたて熱々だ。
かじってみると、ふっくらしていて、思っていたよりしっとりした食感だった。
舌のうえで、ほろほろと餡子が崩れて、甘味が広がる。
[嘉祥]: 「なるほど……ほふほふ……これは、美味しいな」
俺が作る洋菓子も、実家の和菓子も、温かいものを出すということはない。
熱々のまんじゅうを、ほふほふ言いながら食べるのは、これはこれで面白い体験だった。
[嘉祥]: 「そういえば、温泉街には何度か来ているけれど……食べたことなかったな」
昔はネコたちがいなかったからだ。
両親と時雨と俺の４人で旅行しても、買い食いしようなんて話にはならなかった。
reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「Well then, maybe I should have one.」
I buy a hot-spring manju bun from the stand.
It's freshly made and piping hot.
I take a bite into it, and my mouth is greeted by a fluffy and moist sensation.
Atop my tongue, the red bean paste starts to break down, and the sweetness starts to spread.
[Kashou]: 「Now I see... Fff, Fff... This is pretty good.」
Neither the Western sweets I make nor the Japanese sweets my family makes are ever served warm.
Eating a piping-hot manju bun while huffing to cool it down in my mouth is a pretty interesting experience in its own right.
[Kashou]: 「You know, I've been to the hot spring district plenty of times in the past, but... I never ate one of these before.」
Mostly because the catgirls weren't around back then.
Even when the four of us—my parents, Shigure, and I—traveled, buying local snacks and eating never came into the equation.
ModelAnswer:
[嘉祥]: "How about you try one?"  
I bought a steaming hot onsen manjuu from the stall.  
It was piping hot, freshly made.  
Taking a bite, it was fluffy and had a moister texture than I expected.  
The anko crumbled gently in my mouth, spreading its sweetness.  
[嘉祥]: "Ah... hohoho... this is delicious."  
I never serve warm sweets at my patisserie or my family's traditional Japanese confectionery shop.  
Eating a hot manjuu while saying 'hohoho' was quite an interesting experience in itself.  
[嘉祥]: "Come to think of it, I've been to this onsen town several times... but I never ate one."  
It's because there weren't any cats back then.  
Even when my parents, Shigure, and I went on trips together, we never talked about buying snacks like these.

Question:
[嘉祥]: 「やあ、ここに居たのか、時雨。もしかして用事？」
[時雨]: 「いいえ、もう大丈夫です」

[嘉祥]: 「謝るようなことじゃないよ。ソレイユは定休日だけど、世間は平日なんだし」
詳しくは聞いていないが、時雨は会社を経営しているらしい。
その収入で、ネコたちの衣服を買ったり、鈴持ちの受験をさせたり。
父親は俺に対しては厳しいが、妹の時雨には甘い。ネコのことも商売のことも、自由にさせているようだった。
[嘉祥]: 「ネコたちは、思い思いに満喫してたよ。卓球とか、ゲームとか……売店とか」
reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「Heya, so this is where you've been, Shigure? Did you need something?」
[Shigure]: 「No, I'm fine now.」
[Kashou]: 「Did you have to put in a call for work, too, by any chance?」
[Shigure]: 「...Y-Yes. I apologize for doing it in the middle of our vacation.」
[Kashou]: 「Nothing to apologize over. La Soleil may be on a regular holiday, but it is a weekday by normal standards.」
She never told me the specifics, but Shigure apparently runs a company.
With her income, she's able to buy the catgirls' clothes and allow them to take bell-holder exams, among other things.
My dad is harsh toward me, but he's soft toward my younger sister, Shigure. It seems that he is pretty liberal toward the catgirls and his business.
[Kashou]: 「The catgirls are enjoying themselves individually. Playing ping-pong, playing video games... buying from the concession stand.」
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: "Ah, there you are, Shigure. Did something come up?"
[Shigure]: "No, it's alright now."
[Kashou]: "Was that a work call too, by any chance, Shigure?"
[Shigure]: "...Y-yes. I'm sorry. During our trip like this..."
[Kashou]: "Nothing to apologize for. La Soleil is closed today, but the world doesn't stop on weekends."
I didn't ask her about it in detail, but apparently Shigure runs a company.
She uses that income to buy clothes for the cats and pay for Kashou's exams with his bell.
My father is strict with me, but he spoils his daughter, Shigure. He lets her do as she pleases with both the cats and the business.
[Kashou]: "The cats were having a blast doing their own thing—ping-pong, games... shopping..."

Sounds like a plan, then.

Once she starts singing, the mood gets turned on its head.
[Shigure]: 「~~~♪」
[Kashou]: 「...Amazing.」
[Shigure]: 「Hah~ It has been quite some time since I've exerted my voice like that.」
[Kashou]: 「You're REALLY good!」
To be frank, she's practically pro level. I give her generous applause.
ModelAnswer:
[Shigure]: "That's good to hear. ...Brother, how about we spend some quality time together as siblings?"
[Kashou]: "Sure, but what do you want to do?"
[Shigure]: "I heard there's a karaoke room here."
[Kashou]: "Karaoke... I haven't been since high school. Can you even sing, Shigure?"
[Shigure]: "I did choir in my childhood, so I can manage."
That's how it was decided.
[Shigure]: "Then, with all the feelings I have for Brother..."
The atmosphere changed completely as she began to sing.
[Shigure]: "~♪"
[Kashou]: "...Amazing."
[Shigure]: "Haa~, that was my first time singing so loudly in a while."
[Kashou]: "You're incredibly good!"
To be honest, it was professional-level. I gave her unstinting applause.

Yeah, I don't think I can get to sleep.
I exit the room, careful not to make a sound on the way out.

This hot spring district is usually bustling with tourists during the day, but in the wee hours of the night, it has a completely different atmosphere.
I peer down from the bridge.

Depending on where you are, darkness spreads so thickly that you can barely see your own feet.

[Kashou]: 「Sorry... I really just needed to clear my head.」

[Kashou]: 「I don't want you to get the wrong impression, though... It's not like I hate the Minaduki's Japanese-style sweets, got it?」

Nearly lunchtime— After waiting for normal business hours, I find myself in front of the shop.

Question:
[嘉祥]: 「フランスでは、食事のときにケーキを食べるのは、ごく普通のことだ」
[嘉祥]: 「一般家庭でも、夕飯は――サラダ、スープ、パン、魚料理、肉料理、チーズ、デザート……みたいに出すからな」
どのくらい皿数を出すかは、各家庭によるが。
[時雨]: 「毎日がフランス料理ですね」
[嘉祥]: 「だから、ほとんど毎日のようにケーキを食べる人も、そう珍しくないんだよ」
[時雨]: 「ふむふむ……なるほど……」
[時雨]: 「なんだか、不思議な感じがします。ご家庭でコース料理だなんて」
[嘉祥]: 「いやいや……日本の一般的な家庭料理だって、別の国の人からしたら、まるで懐石料理だよ」
[嘉祥]: 「お茶、お米、味噌汁、惣菜、肉魚……使っている皿の数には、大差ないだろ？」
[時雨]: 「言われてみれば……！」
reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「But here in France, it's extremely common to eat cake at dinner time.」
[Kashou]: 「Even when it comes to normal families, dinner usually goes: Salad, soup, bread, seafood, meat, cheese, desert.」
How many dishes they produce depends on the family, though.
[Shigure]: 「Every day is French cuisine, then.」
[Kashou]: 「So, yeah, it's not that rare to see most people eating a cake almost every day.」
[Shigure]: 「Mm-hmm, mm-hmm... I see.」
[Shigure]: 「I still find it rather curious that households partake in full course meals.」
[Kashou]: 「Well, I mean... even for general home cooking in Japan, from other countries' perspective, it looks like a Japanese version of a full course meal.」
[Kashou]: 「Tea, white rice, miso soup, entrees, meat, and fish... There's not much difference between the amount of dishes they use.」
[Shigure]: 「Oh, when you put it that way...!」
ModelAnswer:
Minaduki Kashou: "In France, it's quite common to eat cake during meals."
Minaduki Kashou: "Even in ordinary households, dinner is served like this – salad, soup, bread, fish dish, meat dish, cheese, dessert…"
The number of plates varies from household to household.
Minaduki Shigure: "It sounds like every day is French cuisine!"
Minaduki Kashou: "That's why it's not unusual for people to eat cake almost every day."
Minaduki Shigure: "Hmm hmm... I see..."
Minaduki Shigure: "It feels kind of strange. A full course meal at home?"
Minaduki Kashou: "No, no... Even ordinary Japanese home cooking would seem like a kaiseki dinner to people from other countries."
Minaduki Kashou: "Tea, rice, miso soup, side dishes, meat and fish… The number of plates used isn't that different, is it?"
Minaduki Shigure: "Now that you mention it..."

I get started on preparing for opening without any indecision.

[Kashou]: 「Yes...」
I'm guess there's something I'm missing.
Something dad and Mentor both understand.
However, it's not something that can be explained in words.
[Kashou]: 「Unghh...」
I find myself lost with my thoughts running around in circles in my head.

[Kashou]: 「Oh, no! I cannot go back until I find something—anything.」

But it's not something that can be explained with words.

I was troubled, and my thoughts swirled around in my head again.

[Kashou]: "You didn't tell them a lie, did you?"

Question:
[時雨]: 「…………えっ？」
[ベニエ]: 「貴女も、いろいろなことへ目を向けたほうがいいと思うの。小さな画面を通してではなく」
[時雨]: 「申し訳ございません……私は、兄様がいない世界では、生きていけないのです」

[ベニエ]: 「そうなの？　残念だわ」
[時雨]: 「ふぅ……さすがは、兄様の師匠様……ベニエさんのほうが上手ですね」
[嘉祥]: 「師匠がどこまで本気なのか、わからないけれど……フレーズが広く世界を知ったほうがいいというのは、俺も賛成だ」

reference_answer:
[Shigure]: 「...Huh?」
[Beignet]: 「I think it'd be best for you to look at what the world has to offer, as well. In person and not through a small screen.」
[Shigure]: 「You must forgive me... I cannot live in a world without Nii-sama.」
[Shigure]: 「I need three things: water, air, and Nii-sama.」
[Beignet]: 「Is that so? What a shame.」
[Shigure]: 「Phew... As expected of Nii-sama's mentor... Beignet-san makes better arguments.」
[Kashou]: 「I'm not sure how much of that was true, but... I also agree that Fraise should learn more about the world.」
[Kashou]: 「But, it doesn't have to be right away. Whenever the time comes where you want to do that, I'll do everything in my power to help you, Fraise.」
[Fraise]: 「...Thank you very much. When that time does come, I would appreciate it.」
ModelAnswer:
SHIGURE: "...Eh?"
BEIGNET: "I think you should pay attention to various things, not just through a small screen."
SHIGURE: "I apologize... I can't live in a world without my brother."
SHIGURE: "I need water, air, and my brother."
BEIGNET: "Is that so? How disappointing."
SHIGURE: "Fuu... As expected of my brother's mentor... You're better at this than me, Beignet-san."
KASHOU: "I don't know how serious the master is about all this, but I agree with Fraise learning more about the world."
KASHOU: "But there's no need to rush... When you want to do it... I'll help as much as I can, Fraise."
FRAISE: "...Thank you. Someday, when that time comes, please."

BEIGNE: "No… I've said too much."

[Shigure]: 「Unless you open the windows and dust almost daily, the smell of mildew will instantly grow.」
[Kashou]: 「Is that how it works?」

[Shigure]: 「I open the windows, air out the inside, wipe down your desk, and check the comfort levels of your bed.」
[Kashou]: 「O-Oh, I see.」
Is there a need for a daily check of my bed's comfort levels...?

[Shigure]: "I open the window, air out the space, wipe down the desk with a dry cloth, and check how comfortable the bed is."

[Shigure]: "I think Beignet-san was probably waiting for my brother to come back all this time."
[Kashou]: "Is that so..."

Question:
[時雨]: 「間違いありません。話題になったことで大勢が情報を調べ、名店という評価が多かったからこそ。相乗効果です」
[嘉祥]: 「俺としては、師匠の素晴らしいケーキをより多くの人が知ってくれたから、嬉しいけど」
[フレーズ]: 「ううぅ……明日もこの調子だと、ちょっと大変かもしれません」
[ベニエ]: 「今日が特別だったのよ、きっと」
[ベニエ]: 「今日みたいな行列は、明日はないと思うわ」
[フレーズ]: 「そうですよね……明日は、またパティシエールとわたしだけになりますから」
俺たちは、今夜には発つ予定だった。フランスと日本の時差は７時間。約束の３日間で帰宅するには、そのくらいの時間に出なくては。
結局、俺は自分に足りないものが、まだわからないでいた。
気持ち的には、だいぶ楽になったのだが……
reference_answer:
[Shigure]: 「That is absolutely right. The shop becoming a hot topic led to a majority of people looking into information, which led to a lot of rave reviews. It's synergy.」
[Kashou]: 「Personally, I'm glad that a lot of people know about your incredible cakes, Mentor.」
[Fraise]: 「Unghhh... If tomorrow is like it was today, then we might have more than a little problem.」
[Beignet]: 「I'm sure that today was just a special case.」
[Beignet]: 「I don't think we'll have lines out the door again tomorrow.」
[Fraise]: 「Right... Tomorrow will just be Pâtissière and me.」
We both have plans to depart tonight. There's a seven hour time difference between France and Japan, so we need to leave by then in order to make it back home when I promised.
In the end, I still don't know what it is I'm missing.
I feel a lot better mentally, though...
ModelAnswer:
[Shigure]: "That's right. Because it became a topic of conversation, many people researched the information and gave high praise to the restaurant. It was a synergistic effect."
[Kashou]: "As for me, I'm happy that more people got to know about my mentor's wonderful cake."
[Fraise]: "Uuu... If things keep going like this tomorrow, it might be a bit difficult."
[Beignet]: "Today was probably special."
[Beignet]: "I don't think there will be such a long line tomorrow."
[Fraise]: "That's right... Tomorrow, it'll just be me and the pastry chef again."
We were supposed to leave tonight. The time difference between France and Japan is 7 hours. To get home within our promised three days, we needed to depart around that time.
In the end, I still didn't know what was missing in myself...
Emotionally, things had gotten a lot easier...

Question:
[嘉祥]: 「あ、すみません……」
[ベニエ]: 「結局、お役に立てなかったわね」
[嘉祥]: 「いや、そんなことは！」
[嘉祥]: 「あ……まぁ……まだ、父親の言う芯ってのは、よくわかっていません」
[嘉祥]: 「でも、この場所へ来て、お店を手伝って、思い出しました」
[嘉祥]: 「俺は、やっぱり、皆を笑顔にするケーキが作りたい」
[嘉祥]: 「師匠の作るケーキは、本当に美味しくて、優しい味で……皆を笑顔にしてくれるんです」
[ベニエ]: 「……ありがとう。そう言ってもらえて、嬉しいわ」
[嘉祥]: 「俺は、なんだか、いろいろと考えすぎて……最初の気持ちを忘れていたというか……」
[嘉祥]: 「口では目指していると言いつつ、別のことに捕らわれていたように思います」
reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「Oh, my apologies...」
[Beignet]: 「Looks like I wasn't able to help after all.」
[Kashou]: 「No, that's not true!」
[Kashou]: 「Eh. Well... I'm just still lost on what my father meant by a 'core'.」
[Kashou]: 「But after coming here and helping in the shop, I remembered something.」
[Kashou]: 「I really do want to make cakes that bring smiles to everyone's faces.」
[Kashou]: 「Mentor, your cakes are so good and have such a gentle flavor... that they bring smiles to people's faces.」
[Beignet]: 「...Thank you. It warms my heart to hear you say that.」
[Kashou]: 「It's sort of like I've been thinking of so much... I've lost sight of my initial focus...」
[Kashou]: 「I may have said that was my goal, but I was trapped by something else.」
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: "Ah, I'm sorry..."
[Beignet]: "In the end, I couldn't be of much help, huh?"
[Kashou]: "No, that's not it!"
[Kashou]: "Well... um... I still don't really understand what my father meant by 'core'..."
[Kashou]: "But coming to this place and helping out in the shop reminded me."
[Kashou]: "I want to make cakes that bring smiles to everyone's faces, after all."
[Kashou]: "The cakes you make, Mentor, are truly delicious and have such a gentle flavor... they really make people smile."
[Beignet]: "...Thank you. I'm glad to hear you say that."
[Kashou]: "I guess I was overthinking things... or rather, I'd forgotten my initial feelings..."
[Kashou]: "Even though I said I aimed for it, I think I was caught up in other things."

reference_answer:
[Beignet]: 「Just as I've said before, I don't know what your father meant, but I support you, regardless.」
[Kashou]: 「Thank you very much.」
[Kashou]: 「Speaking of which, I've talked about my reasons for cake-making plenty of times, but... you've never talked about yours, have you, Mentor?」
[Beignet]: 「...That's right.」
[Kashou]: 「Well, when I asked you in the past, I remember you answered, 'I make cakes because I'm a pâtissière', but...」
[Beignet]: 「Hehe... Did I now?」
[Kashou]: 「In that case, what about your reasons for being a pâtissière in the first place?」
[Beignet]: 「...This pâtissièrie... has been making cakes since my grandmother's generation.」
[Beignet]: 「And while not to the extent of your family, I do think that it has a tradition that needs to be protected.」
ModelAnswer:

Kashou Minaduki: "Thank you."
Kashou Minaduki: "Speaking of which, I've told you many times why I make cakes... But I haven't heard about you, have I?"
Beignet: "...That's right."
Kashou Minaduki: "Well, the last time I asked, you said it was because you're a pâtissière..."
Beignet: "Hehe... Did I say that?"
Kashou Minaduki: "Then, what about the reason why you became a pâtissière in the first place?"
Beignet: "...This shop has been in my family since my grandmother's time. We've always made cakes."
Beignet: "It may not be as grand as your family's tradition, Kashou, but I believe there are traditions worth preserving."

I avoided mentioning that our family's traditional Japanese sweets shop was an old-established business when joining as an apprentice to learn Western pastries...

reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「Yeah, I'm starting to think those were just words.」
[Shigure]: 「No way! No way they're just words...」
[Kashou]: 「No, I mean the real reason deep in my heart... I tried giving my own feelings some deep thought.」
[Kashou]: 「Ultimately, I... just want dad to approve of me.」
[Kashou]: 「A little too old to be going through my rebellious teenager phase, I know.」
[Kashou]: 「I'm pretty sure I'm being egotistical and trying to seek approval.」
[Kashou]: 「Sorry, Shigure. Did I shatter your illusion of me...?」
[Shigure]: 「Is that your reason for making pastries, Nii-sama?」
[Kashou]: 「If it wasn't, I wouldn't be this broken up about dad disapproving of me.」

Kashou: "Am I just going through a rebellious phase at this age?"
Kashou: "I'm probably an egoist filled with the desire for approval, aren't I?"
Kashou: "Sorry, Shigure... did I disappoint you...?"

Kashou: "If it weren't for that, I wouldn't be so troubled just because Dad denies me."
Shigure: "Maybe there is some of that feeling."

Figuring that the catgirls would be at the shop, Shigure comes with me to La Soleil instead of the Minaduki house.

Plus, we did so much work on our feet overseas.

Shigure gives a firm smile, but she can't hide her exhaustion.

Kashou: "This pilgrimage was tougher than I thought."
Especially since I had to stand for most of it over there.

She puts on a brave smile, but she can't hide her fatigue.

Shigure: "An overnight stay!?"

[嘉祥]: 「俺も驚いたけどな」
[淡雪]: 「お土産のフィナンシェが美味しかったから許したわ♪」
母親は怒ると海より深く静かに怒るタイプだが、美味しい食べ物で、だいたい何でも許してくれるのだった。
reference_answer:
[Maple]: 「That reminds me, did he ever forgive you for just up and going to France, Shigure?」
[Shigure]: 「Urk...」
[Cinnamon]: 「Aah~ You only left a letter behind, which made Mom upset, right~?」
[Awayuki]: 「That's right. She just ran off out of the blue without discussing it at all; it worried me sick.」
[Shigure]: 「I apologize for that...」
[Awayuki]: 「Oh well, it seems that you were with Kashou anyway.」
[Kashou]: 「Yeah, which was a surprise to me, too.」
[Awayuki]: 「The financier you gave me as a souvenir was delicious, so you're forgiven♪」
My mother is the type that when she gets angry, her anger is as deep and silent as the ocean. She forgives almost anything if you give her something tasty, though.
ModelAnswer:

AWAYUKI: "But well, since Kashou was with you and all..."
KASHOU: "Even I was surprised though."
AWAYUKI: "The financiers you brought back as souvenirs were delicious, so I forgave you♪"
Her mother had a way of getting angry that was deeper and quieter than the ocean, but she would forgive almost anything with some tasty food.

reference_answer:

[Azuki]: 「Shigure?!」

[character] Name: Minaduki Awayuki (水無月 淡雪) | Gender: Female
[character] Name: Minaduki Shigure (水無月 時雨) | Gender: Female
Question:
[時雨]: 「わぁ、クリスマスのプレゼントですか！？ありがとうございます、母様！」
[淡雪]: 「ちょっと早いかもしれないけれど、嘉祥ってば、また怒って帰っちゃうかもしれないでしょう？」
[時雨]: 「うっ……」
[嘉祥]: 「そ、それは今日はないから！　信用してって」
[淡雪]: 「はい、嘉祥にも」
[嘉祥]: 「あ、うん……ありがとう」
[淡雪]: 「開けてみて？」
言われるがままに、包装紙を取って小箱を開けた。
[嘉祥]: 「……写真立て？」
写真は入っていないようだ。
[淡雪]: 「今年の想い出の１枚を部屋に飾ってみたら、楽しいと思うのよ？」
そういえば、母親が欲しがっていたとかで、誕生日に時雨がプレゼントしたのを思い出す。
reference_answer:
[Shigure]: 「Wow, a Christmas present?! Thank you so much, Mother!」
[Awayuki]: 「It might be a bit early, but Kashou just might get all huffy and go back home again.」
[Shigure]: 「Urk...」
[Kashou]: 「Th-That's not happening today! C'mon, believe me!」
[Awayuki]: 「And for you, too, Kashou.」
[Kashou]: 「Oh, yeah... Thanks.」
[Awayuki]: 「Open it.」
I remove the wrapping paper and open the small box as instructed.
[Kashou]: 「...A picture frame?」
It doesn't have a picture in it.
[Awayuki]: 「I think it'd be fun if you'd decorate your rooms with your best memory from this past year.」
That reminds me that my mother wanted a picture frame and Shigure got her one as a birthday present.
ModelAnswer:
[Shigure]: "Wow, a Christmas present!? Thank you so much, Mother!"
[Awayuki]: "It might be a little early, but Kashou might get angry and go home again, right?"
[Shigure]: "Ugh..."
[Kashou]: "N-No way that'll happen today! Please believe me."
[Awayuki]: "Okay, I believe you too, Kashou."
[Kashou]: "Ah, yeah... thanks."
[Awayuki]: "Why don't you open it?"

As instructed, she removed the wrapping paper and opened the small box.
[Kashou]: "...A photo frame?"
It didn't seem to contain a photograph.

[Awayuki]: "I thought it would be fun if you put up one of this year's memories in your room?" 

Come to think of it, Shigure remembered that she had given him one for his birthday because her mother wanted one.

Question:
[ショコラ]: 「ご主人さまの！　あ、でも、どの写真が……うーん……」
[ショコラ]: 「あ、ソレイユ開店記念のときの写真にする。　ご主人さまとバニラと３人で撮ったやつ！」
[バニラ]: 「いいね。グッドチョイス。私も、そうする」
[メイプル]: 「あたしは、どうしようかしら？」
[シナモン]: 「アレがいいんじゃない～？　船で一緒に歌ったときの」
[シナモン]: 「動画だけじゃなく、写真も撮ってもらってたよね～？」
[メイプル]: 「あー。」
[メイプル]: 「……そうね。　ちょっと恥ずかしい気もするけれど」
[メイプル]: 「あれが、この１年で私にとって、一番大切な想い出だわ」
[シナモン]: 「メーちゃんの一番大切な思い出に……わたしも写って……はぁはぁ……うっ」
[メイプル]: 「え？　自分だけ写ってる写真なんだけど……？」
reference_answer:
[Chocola]: 「One of Master! Oh, but, which one? Hmm...」
[Chocola]: 「Oh, I'll put in the photo to commemorate the opening of La Soleil. The one with you, Master, and Chocola!」
[Vanilla]: 「Nice. Good choice. I'll do the same.」
[Maple]: 「What should I go with?」
[Cinnamon]: 「Why not that one~? You know, the one of us singing on the boat together.」
[Cinnamon]: 「They didn't just take videos; there's photos from then, too, right~?」
[Maple]: 「Aah, yeah.」
[Maple]: 「...Right. I feel like that'd be kind of embarrassing.」
[Maple]: 「But that is the most precious memory of the year to me.」
[Cinnamon]: 「I'm going to be in... May-chan's most precious memory... Hah, hah... Uhhh...」
[Maple]: 「Huh? I'm picking one with just me in it, though...」
